metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5839 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
WordPress before 4.5.3 allows remote attackers to bypass thesanitize_file_name protection mechanism via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5839` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentytwo - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.5.3+dfsg-1').
